p.s: In lines 60-61 there is a personification My ears have not yet drunk a hundred words.
This personification shows that while Romeo and Juliet don't even know each other for a long time, they could hear them just by some sounds.
Additionally the author gives a simile for a contrast in line 71-72 there lies more peril in thine eye than twenty of their swords.
This shows how Romeo feels the love of Juliet.
In linelines 72-73 Romeo say'ssays look thou but sweet, and I am proof against their enmity.
This also shows how strong theretheir love can be against their problems.
In linelines 77-78 Romeo says My life were better ended by their hate, than death prorogued, wanting of thy love.
He can't wait longer to be together with her just because of the clash between the familysfamilies.
Lines 83-84 give another point that Juliet is everything for Romeo and that he will go everywhere and pay everything to get with her.
In line 98 Juliet contradicts her sentences before where she criticizes Romeo in his behaviour with her statements In truth, fair Montague, I am too fond.
This shows that however the situation between them and their family'sfamilies is, they will love each other for everforever.
His gracious self should be her god of idolatry(ll. 114-115).
This also underlines the opinion of Romeo and Juliet to themselves.
To conclude it's to note that extract is written in informal language and the narrative perspective is the first person narrator.
This perspective is chosen to get clear about the character's feelings.
